genres.name: comedy
genres.description: Books intended to be humorous or amusing by inducing laughter

genres.name: classic
genres.description: Fiction that has become part of an accepted literary canon, widely taught in schools

genres.name: drama
genres.description: Specific mode of fiction represented in performance. The term comes from a Greek word meaning "action" (Classical Greek: δρᾶμα, drama), which is derived from "to do" (Classical Greek: δράω, drao)

genres.name: fantasy
genres.description: Fiction genre that uses magic or other supernatural elements as a main plot element, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in imaginary worlds where magic and magical creatures are common.

genres.name: horror
genres.description: Fiction which is intended to, or has the capacity to frighten, scare, disgust, or startle their readers or viewers by inducing feelings of horror and terror.

genres.name: science fiction
genres.description: Genre of speculative fiction typically dealing with imaginative concepts such as futuristic science and technology, space travel, time travel, faster than light travel, parallel universes, and extraterrestrial life.
